data.title: Moving to the end of physical EOL in wrapped-up text
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set wrap-up for text with long lines
2. END key will move cursor to logical EOL, but I want to move to physical (where \n is) EOL as well

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: [ubuntu 16.04] code resource usage gradually increasing and eventually crashing system

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:
1.13.1
379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89
- OS Version: Linux my-system-name 4.4.0-81-generic #104-Ubuntu SMP Wed Jun 14 08:17:06 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Just opened code with my home folder. 
![screenshot from 2017-06-29 00-33-24](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4033256/27655650-b1979c30-5c63-11e7-9f9f-660dadd035e6.png)
![screenshot from 2017-06-29 00-33-42](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4033256/27655660-b90ad3ec-5c63-11e7-877b-380dfe7d2bbb.png)
Even after I closed the code window one process is still running and its memory usage keeps increasing
![screenshot from 2017-06-29 00-34-09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4033256/27655679-c3aee176-5c63-11e7-8ca3-ae9935c3efe7.png)
After sometime my system will be unresponsive. 

```
Updating C/C++ dependencies...

Downloading package 'C/C++ language components (Linux)' 
```
The above update is running as soon as I open code and my internet is slow one. Haven't seen this issue till now

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Task is running in terminal with "runner": "process"
data.body:
1.14.0-insider
b508e11e5a8b90c8fa19e6e3a7d8ccd57ab6e9b7

In the latest insiders I don't see spinner when tsc watch task is executed in status bar (it was before update). 
Then I read the docs about tasks updates
I tried to add `"runner": "process",` to task:

```
{
  // See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558
  // for the documentation about the tasks.json format
    "tasks": [
    {
      "taskName": "tsc",
      "version": "0.1.0",
      "runner": "process",
      "command": "node",
      "isShellCommand": true,
      "args": [       
        "./node_modules/typescript/lib/tsc.js", 
        "-w",
        "-p",
        "."
      ],
      "showOutput": "silent",
      "isBackground": true,
      "problemMatcher": "$tsc-watch"
    }    
  ]
}
```

**but it still runs in terminal.** How to make it run as a process?

data.title: Make it possible to disable mouseover tooltips
data.body: When I mouseover a variable or something in the code there's a tooltip that pops up that displays some information about the variable. I'd like to disable this but there's no property in the settings for doing so. The closest was `editor.disableParameterHints` but that doesn't work for variables and object properties for example.

data.title: Cannot copy/paste files between root folders
data.body: Testing #29176 I'd expect to be able to copy a file from root folder A and paste it to root folder B. - The keyboard shortcuts (cmd+c cmd+v) work, but only within one folder. - After copying a file, right clicking the folder name and selecting paste works in its own root folder, but the paste option is grayed out for a different root folder.

data.title: 'Open Folder' in Explorer Not Working in Second Window

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.0|
|vscode-JS-CSS-HTML-formatter|lonefy|0.2.3|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.11.0|
|team|ms-vsts|1.119.0|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.1.6|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.10.1|;


---

### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a window in VSCode
2. Navigate to Explorer and click 'Open Folder'. Open a desired folder.
3. Open a second window in VSCode
4. Repeat step 2. 

The result is that only the first window will have the folder opened, and in the second window nothing will happen. Frustrating when trying to use multiple windows to program on multiple screens with the same base repository.

data.title: "Remove root folder" option available but not working for initial root
data.body: Testing #29176 - Open folder A - Add root folder B - Right click folder A: I would expect "remove root folder" to remove the folder I've selected, but it does nothing - Right click folder B: "remove root folder" works as expected

data.title: Ctrl-C doesn't break in terminal
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version:
Version 1.14.0-insider
Commit 73015a5e052e6de8ecd60eed2670bea81fad8cac
Date 2017-06-16T05:13:31.107Z
Shell 1.6.6
Renderer 56.0.2924.87
Node 7.4.0

- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro
10.0.15063

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a long-running terminal application in the integrated terminal
2. Press Ctrl-C

The terminal does not get a break signal; instead, a copy is attempted (and failed because there is not selection). I saw a message displayed once that the copy failed but I didn't screenshot it in time and I haven't seen it again.

I've checked my `keybindings.json` and there is nothing relevant there. The only relevant binding is the default binding:

    { "key": "ctrl+c",                "command": "workbench.action.terminal.copySelection",
                                      "when": "terminalFocus && terminalTextSelected" },

Which shouldn't happen when `!terminalTextSelected` but appears to still happen instead of passing the binding through.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Set placeholder text in SourceControlInputBox
data.body: Implement #24090

data.title: Customizing a TypeScript build task should include the used ProblemMatcher
Use global TypeScript version
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: `1.13.0`
- OS Version: `Windows 10 - 1607 - 14393.1358`

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open command pallet
2. Enter `TypeScript: Select TypeScript Version`

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: `N / A`

The `Select TypeScript Version` dialog presents the workspace typescript version (installed with `npm install typescript`) or VSCode's bundled version.

This works great however it doesn't show the global (`npm install -g typescript`) version.

Obviously any easy workaround is to have TypeScript installed in the workspace and kept up to date, however this is a bit of a waste of disk space for smaller projects

data.title: [Requests] Insert space before or after * in generator function
data.body:
Hi. This is a feature request about javascript format.
There are three formats in javascript generator function as follows: 
1. `function* gen()`
2. `function * gen()`
3. `function *gen()`

However, every time I format my js file, it will always be the first. 
It'll be better if we can choose which one. How about adding properties in `settings.json`, such as `javascript.format.insertSpaceBeforeGeneratorStar`, `javascript.format.insertSpaceAfterGeneratorStar`.

data.title: Deleting a folder and undo from Finder is not retrieving the folder in VS Code

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #29478

- Open a Folder in VS Code
- Assume above folder has a sub folder say `Sub Folder`
- Go to Finder and delete `Sub Folder`
- Observe that it is removed from VS Code - 👍 
- Undo the action in Finder by `cmd+z`. Folder comes back in Finder

Expected folder to come back in VS Code but not.

data.title: Deleting a folder with unicode characters is not reflected
data.body:
Testing #29478

Mac OS 10.12.5

- Open a folder in VS Code
- Assume that above folder has a sub folder with name `áâã`
- Delete above folder `áâã` from Finder

Expected that this is also removed from VS Code, but not. It works with other folders.

data.title: Unable to open file with leading space in file name when passed as a parameter from command line

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Win10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a file with leading space, e.g. " my file.txt"
2. Whilst in the text file folder, pass the file name to VS Code from command line, e.g. "c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\Code.exe" " my file.txt"; VSCode will try to open file "my file.txt" (space removed). 
4. When doing the same with full file path, e.g. "c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\Code.exe" "c:\ my file.txt"; VSCode will not open any file

Note: When opening from within Code by File->Open, everything works fine

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Cannot search specific file types anymore
data.body: * Open `vscode` * Right click on `src` * Choose Find in Folder * this used to pop up the search viewlet with `./src` in the files to include. It used to be able for me to append `/**/*.ts` to that value (i.e. `./src/**/*.ts`) to search only in TypeScript files. * this is no longer possible: `/Users/alex/src/vscode/src/**/*.ts` never finds anything * please note that I do not have multiple folders opened 1.13: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (63def6eb989d62f23d3711ace0f795ce9f23551d, 2017-06-28T05:07:46.148Z):

data.title: More Task API feedback
data.body:
Last round, I promise

* I'd to rename `RebuildAll` to `Rebuild`, we also just call it `Clean` and `Build`
* I'd add the `[name:string]: any` signature to `TaskDefinition` to make clear that there is more
* I'd make `Task#source` not optional because it's also not optional in the ctor and since we want it in the UI
